snippet: Any action against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria is seen as having unintended and potentially harmful consequences.
abstract: Militants of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria are widely loathed, but actions to curb them are elusive because they could have potentially harmful and unintended consequences.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Tim Arango from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Any action against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria is seen as having unintended and potentially harmful consequences.

headline.main: Islamic Militants in Iraq Are Widely Loathed, Yet Action to Curb Them Is Elusive
headline.print_headline: Islamic Militants in Iraq Are Widely Loathed, Yet Action to Curb Them Is Elusive
